growing.soil: Well-draining, slightly acidic; hilltop or slope ideal

companion: Other cherry varieties for cross-pollination (especially for sweet cherries)

pruning: Prune during winter (similar to apple and peach)
Remove weak, diseased, or injured branches
Remove inward, crossing, or upright branches
Limit the number of branches to maintain airflow and structure

harvestingAndUsage.whenToHarvest: When cherries reach deep color and can be easily plucked from the tree
harvestingAndUsage.howToHarvest: Gently pull or twist to release from the stem

pollinators: Sweet cherries require cross-pollination (bees and other pollinators)
ecologicalInfo.wildlifeResistance: Birds are attracted to the fruit; nets are recommended for protection
